sentences.sContent: Cold worlds shake from the oar.
sentences.sCn: 冰冷的世界从桨上摇落。

sentences.sContent: The roaring oar hit the coarse keyboard on the cupboard aboard the boat.
sentences.sContent_eng: The roaring oar hit the coarse keyboard on the cupboard aboard the boat.
sentences.sCn: 轰鸣的桨击中了船上碗柜上的粗糙键盘。

sentences.sContent: Suchen never understood what had driven her to grasp the oar at the last moment.
sentences.sContent_eng: Suchen never understood what had driven her to grasp the oar at the last moment.
sentences.sCn: 苏晨从来没有想明白，是什么驱使她在最后一刻抓住了一条船桨。

trans.tranOther: a long pole with a wide flat blade at one end, used for rowing a boat
